item.title: Run Qiskit Code Assistant Locally easily!
item.description:
Don‚Äôt have access to the Qiskit Code Assistant because you‚Äôre not on an IBM Quantum Premium plan?

No worries‚Äîyou can run it directly on your computer! We‚Äôve recently improved the local setup experience. With our scripts, you can:

  • ‚úÖ Download the LLM optimized for local enviroments (GGUF)
  • ‚úÖ Enable inference on your machine (through Ollama)
  • ‚úÖ Automatically configure the Qiskit Code Assistant VSCode or JupyterLab extension

Give it a try and share your feedback‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to hear how you use it!

More info: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-local#quick-start-recommended

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #Ollama #OpenSource #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on December 2, 2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant Upgraded to Mistral-Small-3.2-24B-Qiskit
item.description:
We’ve upgraded the Qiskit Code Assistant! üöÄ

Last month, we introduced mistral-small-3.2-24b-qiskit, replacing granite-3.3-8b-qiskit.

Key Improvements

‚úÖ Better accuracy: The new model ranks higher across key benchmarks, including QiskitHumanEval, QiskitHumanEval Hard, HumanEval, MathQA, ASDiv, SciQ and others (see the model card for more info).

‚úÖ Improved UX: More precise responses for quantum programming tasks.

‚úÖ Open access: Available on Hugging Face ‚Üí https://huggingface.co/Qiskit/mistral-small-3.2-24b-qiskit.

This update is part of our mission to make quantum development more intuitive and efficient. üåü

Explore it, test it, and share your feedback!

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #OpenSource #HuggingFace

Originally shared on LinkedIn on November 27, 2025

item.title: qiskit-ibm-transpiler Ranks #3 in Unitary Foundation 2025 Survey
item.description:
üöÄ üöÄüöÄ Climbing the ranks in quantum software!

I’m thrilled to share that the qiskit-ibm-transpiler library has moved up to #3 in the Unitary Foundation 2025 Survey under Full-stack development platforms, compilers, and simulators. Just last year, we were #4 ‚Äî and this year‚Äôs leap is a testament to the incredible work of the team behind it.

In less than two years, the package has surpassed 929K downloads, becoming a relevant tool for quantum circuit optimization/transpilation across the community.

One of the most exciting updates this year: our AI transpiler passes ‚Äî including the latest Pauli Networks pass ( arXiv:2503.14448) ‚Äî can now run in local mode, removing the need for an IBM Quantum premium plan. This makes advanced AI-powered transpilation more accessible than ever.

The Unitary Fund survey is widely recognized as the primary pulse check for quantum software adoption and developer preferences. Seeing our work reflected there is both humbling and energizing.

Huge kudos to the amazing team behind this David Kremer, V√≠ctor Villar Pascual, Jes√∫s Talavera G√≥mez, Yaiza Garc√≠a Mart√≠n-Mantero, Ismael Faro ‚Äî your dedication, creativity, and deep technical insight are what make this possible. And thank you to the community for your continued trust and feedback.

Let‚Äôs keep pushing the boundaries of quantum + AI software together.

#QuantumComputing #Qiskit #IBMQuantum #AITranspiler #UnitaryFund #QuantumSoftware #OpenSource #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on November 10, 2025 - 50 reactions as of 11/11/2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant: New Open-Source LLM Models Released
item.description:
üöÄ We’re thrilled to announce the latest open-source LLM releases from the Qiskit Code Assistant team! üöÄ

These new models bring enhanced capabilities and broader compatibility to quantum computing development.

What’s New:

‚ú® Qiskit 2.0 Compatibility - Our newer models are fully compatible with Qiskit 2.0 code, ensuring seamless development with the latest quantum computing framework

üß† Enhanced Text Understanding - Significant improvements in general text comprehension and code generation capabilities

üî¨ Expanding Our Horizons - We continue to leverage the newest stable versions of IBM Granite 3.2 and 3.3 models, while for the first time exploring beyond IBM Granite with the powerful Qwen2.5-Coder series

Available Models: ‚Ä¢ Granite 3.3 8B Qiskit (+ GGUF) ‚Ä¢ Granite 3.2 8B Qiskit (+ GGUF) ‚Ä¢ Qwen2.5-Coder 14B Qiskit (+ GGUF)

All models are available on Hugging Face and ready for local deployment!

üîó Browse All Models: https://huggingface.co/Qiskit üîó Get Started: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-local

We’d love to hear how you’re making the most of these models! Share your experiences and quantum development journey with us. üåü

Big thanks to the team involved in this release, specially to Nicolas Dupuis, Adarsh Tiwari and Ismael Faro

#QuantumComputing #OpenSource #AI #LLMs #Qiskit #IBM #TechInnovation #QuantumDevelopment #QiskitCodeAssistant

Originally shared on LinkedIn on July 8, 2025 - 304 reactions, 16 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant
item.description:
A family of LLMs (8B‚Äì24B parameters) specialized for quantum code generation. Models built on IBM Granite, Mistral, and Qwen foundations, fine-tuned on curated Qiskit datasets including Python scripts, Jupyter notebooks, and synthetic Q&A pairs.

Open-source model family:

  • Mistral Small 24B ‚Äî Largest model, highest accuracy
  • Qwen2.5 Coder 14B ‚Äî Strong coding foundation
  • Granite 3.x 8B ‚Äî Efficient, multiple versions
  • GGUF quantized versions available for local deployment

Achieves 46.53% on Qiskit HumanEval‚Äîsignificantly outperforming competing models (24.75%‚Äì39.6%). Supports natural language to code (“define a Bell circuit and run it on ibm_brisbane”) and intelligent autocomplete.

We created and open-sourced Qiskit HumanEval and Qiskit HumanEval Hard‚Äîbenchmarks with 150+ tasks each, now used industry-wide for evaluating quantum code LLMs. Integrated into VS Code and JupyterLab.

item.title: qiskit-ibm-transpiler
item.description:
AI-powered quantum circuit optimization that outperforms traditional heuristics. Uses reinforcement learning to achieve near-optimal synthesis of Linear Function, Clifford, and Permutation circuits‚Äîorders of magnitude faster than SAT solvers. Our Pauli Network synthesis delivers over 2√ó reduction in two-qubit gate count, with average improvements of 20% and up to 60% on the Benchpress benchmark.

Supports hardware-aware routing up to 133 qubits and works as a drop-in replacement for standard Qiskit transpilation. Available as both local execution (with our open-source RL models) and cloud-based services.

Achievements: #3 in Unitary Foundation 2025 Survey ‚Ä¢ 929K+ downloads ‚Ä¢ 56 releases ‚Ä¢ Apache 2.0

item.title: Qiskit Gym
item.description:
Gymnasium-compatible RL environments for training AI agents to synthesize quantum circuits. The framework that powers the AI transpiler passes achieving state-of-the-art results in qiskit-ibm-transpiler.

Three synthesis environments:

  • Permutation Synthesis ‚Äî Minimal SWAP gate implementations respecting hardware coupling
  • Linear Function Synthesis ‚Äî CNOT-optimal decomposition of Boolean linear functions
  • Clifford Synthesis ‚Äî Hardware-efficient implementations of Clifford group elements

Hardware-aware design matches real quantum device coupling maps. High-performance Rust backend enables fast training. Supports PPO, AlphaZero, and custom policies with built-in TensorBoard visualization.

The agents trained with this framework achieve near-optimal synthesis up to 65 qubits‚Äîorders of magnitude faster than SAT solvers.

item.title: qiskit-ibm-transpiler Ranks #4 in Unitary Fund 2024 Survey
item.description:
üéâ Exciting news! The qiskit-ibm-transpiler has been recognized as the “4th most used quantum computing development tool globally” in the 2024 Unitary Fund survey under the “Full-stack development platforms, compilers, and simulators” category.

What makes this particularly remarkable? The project has only been publicly available for just over a year!

üîç What is the qiskit-ibm-transpiler?

It’s a library that combines Qiskit’s powerful heuristic algorithms with our cutting-edge AI transpiler passes. Think of it as a sophisticated translator that optimizes your quantum code to run more efficiently on real quantum hardware.

üåç What this means:

This recognition reflects both the growing adoption of quantum computing and the community’s trust in AI-powered tools. It’s an acknowledgment of not just our technology, but of every developer who has contributed to and embraced this project.

üîó Resources:

  • GitHub: https://github.com/Qiskit/qiskit-ibm-transpiler
  • Documentation: https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/transpile/qiskit-ibm-transpiler

Thank you to everyone who has been part of this journey. Here’s to pushing the boundaries of quantum computing together! üöÄ

#QuantumComputing #OpenSource #Qiskit #IBM #SoftwareDevelopment #AITranspilerPasses #QiskitIBMTranspiler #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on December 17, 2024 - 79 reactions, 1 comment as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Introducing Qiskit Code Assistant: New Blog Post Published
item.description:
Last week we published a blog post summarizing what is the Qiskit Code Assistant and how you can start to use it.

Following the recent launch, users are already leveraging the tool’s features. We’re actively developing improved models with enhanced capabilities that we’re planning to release as open source!
